qas.question: During what decade did the Seljuk Turks occupy Armenia?
In what yer was the Battle of Manzikert fought?
Who was taken prisoner at the Battle of Manzikert?
Who conquered Jerusalem from the Turks?
During what century did the Seljuk Turks occupy Persia?

context: In the <a4_0>11th<a4_0/> century, the Seljuk Turks took over much of the Middle East, occupying Persia during the 1040s, Armenia in the <a0_0>1060s<a0_0/>, and Jerusalem in 1070. In <a1_0>1071<a1_0/>, the Turkish army defeated the Byzantine army at the Battle of Manzikert and captured the <a2_0>Byzantine Emperor Romanus IV<a2_0/> (r. 1068–71). The Turks were then free to invade Asia Minor, which dealt a dangerous blow to the Byzantine Empire by seizing a large part of its population and its economic heartland. Although the Byzantines regrouped and recovered somewhat, they never fully regained Asia Minor and were often on the defensive. The Turks also had difficulties, losing control of Jerusalem to <a3_0>the Fatimids of Egypt<a3_0/> and suffering from a series of internal civil wars. The Byzantines also faced a revived Bulgaria, which in the late 12th and 13th centuries spread throughout the Balkans.
